To prove that Ï•italic-Ï•\phiitalic_Ï• is closed under the applications of the MULTIPLICATION 2 and 3 rules it suffices to prove

{lx,hx}âŠ†â¢intâ¡(Dz/Dy)Â andÂ {ly,hy}âŠ†â¢intâ¡(Dz/Dx).{lx,hx}âŠ†â¢intâ¡(Dz/Dy)Â andÂ {ly,hy}âŠ†â¢intâ¡(Dz/Dx)\mbox{$\mbox{$\{{l_{x},h_{x}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})$ and $\mbox{$\{{l_{y},h_{y}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})$}.{lx,hx} âŠ† roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and {ly,hy} âŠ† roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (7)

We need to distinguish a number of cases. The case analysis depends on the position of 0 w.r.t.Â each of the intervals Dxsubscriptğ·ğ‘¥D_{x}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and Dysubscriptğ·ğ‘¦D_{y}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. This leads to 9 cases, which by symmetry between xğ‘¥xitalic_x and yğ‘¦yitalic_y can be reduced to 6 cases. We present here the proofs for representative 3 cases.

Case 1. lxâ‰¥0,lyâ‰¥0formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥0subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦0l_{x}\geq 0,\ l_{y}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0 , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0.

By the bounds consistency of xğ‘¥xitalic_x for some bâˆˆ[ly,hy]ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘¦b\in[l_{y},h_{y}]italic_b âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have lxâ‹…bâˆˆ[lz,hz]â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘§l_{x}\cdot b\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then bâ‰¤hyğ‘subscriptâ„ğ‘¦b\leq h_{y}italic_b â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and lxâ‰¥0subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥0l_{x}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0, so lxâ‹…bâ‰¤lxâ‹…hyâ‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥ğ‘â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦l_{x}\cdot b\leq l_{x}\cdot h_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b â‰¤ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Also lzâ‰¤lxâ‹…bsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘§â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥ğ‘l_{z}\leq l_{x}\cdot bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b, so

lzâ‰¤lxâ‹…hy.subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦l_{z}\leq l_{x}\cdot h_{y}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Next, by the bounds consistency of yğ‘¦yitalic_y for some aâˆˆ[lx,hx]ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¥a\in[l_{x},h_{x}]italic_a âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have aâ‹…hyâˆˆ[lz,hz]â‹…ğ‘subscriptâ„ğ‘¦subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘§a\cdot h_{y}\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_a â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then lxâ‰¤asubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥ğ‘l_{x}\leq aitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_a and hyâ‰¥0subscriptâ„ğ‘¦0h_{y}\geq 0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0, so lxâ‹…hyâ‰¤aâ‹…hyâ‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦â‹…ğ‘subscriptâ„ğ‘¦l_{x}\cdot h_{y}\leq a\cdot h_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_a â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Also aâ‹…hyâ‰¤hzâ‹…ğ‘subscriptâ„ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘§a\cdot h_{y}\leq h_{z}italic_a â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

lxâ‹…hyâ‰¤hz.â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘§l_{x}\cdot h_{y}\leq h_{z}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

So lxâ‹…hyâˆˆ[lz..hz]l_{x}\cdot h_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] and consequently by the definition of the integer intervals division

lxâˆˆDz/DyÂ andÂ hyâˆˆDz/Dx.lxâˆˆDz/DyÂ andÂ hyâˆˆDz/Dx\mbox{$l_{x}\in D_{z}/D_{y}$ and $h_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}$}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

By a symmetric argument

hxâˆˆDz/DyÂ andÂ lyâˆˆDz/Dx.hxâˆˆDz/DyÂ andÂ lyâˆˆDz/Dx\mbox{$h_{x}\in D_{z}/D_{y}$ and $l_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}$}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Case 2. lxâ‰¥0,hyâ‰¤0formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥0subscriptâ„ğ‘¦0l_{x}\geq 0,\ h_{y}\leq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0 , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ 0.

By the bounds consistency of xğ‘¥xitalic_x for some bâˆˆ[ly,hy]ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘¦b\in[l_{y},h_{y}]italic_b âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have hxâ‹…bâˆˆ[lz,hz]â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘§h_{x}\cdot b\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then bâ‰¤hyğ‘subscriptâ„ğ‘¦b\leq h_{y}italic_b â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hxâ‰¥0subscriptâ„ğ‘¥0h_{x}\geq 0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0, so hxâ‹…bâ‰¤hxâ‹…hyâ‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥ğ‘â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦h_{x}\cdot b\leq h_{x}\cdot h_{y}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Also lzâ‰¤hxâ‹…bsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘§â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥ğ‘l_{z}\leq h_{x}\cdot bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b, so

lzâ‰¤hxâ‹…hy.subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦l_{z}\leq h_{x}\cdot h_{y}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Next, by the bounds consistency of yğ‘¦yitalic_y for some aâˆˆ[lx,hx]ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¥a\in[l_{x},h_{x}]italic_a âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have aâ‹…hyâˆˆ[lz,hz]â‹…ğ‘subscriptâ„ğ‘¦subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘§a\cdot h_{y}\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_a â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then aâ‰¤hxğ‘subscriptâ„ğ‘¥a\leq h_{x}italic_a â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hyâ‰¤0subscriptâ„ğ‘¦0h_{y}\leq 0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ 0, so aâ‹…hyâ‰¥hxâ‹…hyâ‹…ğ‘subscriptâ„ğ‘¦â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦a\cdot h_{y}\geq h_{x}\cdot h_{y}italic_a â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Also hzâ‰¥aâ‹…hysubscriptâ„ğ‘§â‹…ğ‘subscriptâ„ğ‘¦h_{z}\geq a\cdot h_{y}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_a â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

hxâ‹…hyâ‰¤hz.â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘§h_{x}\cdot h_{y}\leq h_{z}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

So hxâ‹…hyâˆˆ[lz..hz]h_{x}\cdot h_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] and consequently by the definition of the integer intervals division

hxâˆˆDz/DyÂ andÂ hyâˆˆDz/Dx.hxâˆˆDz/DyÂ andÂ hyâˆˆDz/Dx\mbox{$h_{x}\in D_{z}/D_{y}$ and $h_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}$}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Further, by the bounds consistency of xğ‘¥xitalic_x for some bâˆˆ[ly,hy]ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘¦b\in[l_{y},h_{y}]italic_b âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have lxâ‹…bâˆˆ[lz,hz]â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘§l_{x}\cdot b\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then lyâ‰¤bsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦ğ‘l_{y}\leq bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_b and lxâ‰¥0subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥0l_{x}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0, so lxâ‹…lyâ‰¤lxâ‹…bâ‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥ğ‘l_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq l_{x}\cdot bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b. Also lxâ‹…bâ‰¤hzâ‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥ğ‘subscriptâ„ğ‘§l_{x}\cdot b\leq h_{z}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

lxâ‹…lyâ‰¤hz.â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘§l_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{z}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Next, by the bounds consistency of yğ‘¦yitalic_y for some aâˆˆ[lx,hx]ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¥a\in[l_{x},h_{x}]italic_a âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have aâ‹…lyâˆˆ[lz,hz]â‹…ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘§a\cdot l_{y}\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_a â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then lxâ‰¤asubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥ğ‘l_{x}\leq aitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_a and ly<0subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦0l_{y}<0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0, so lxâ‹…lyâ‰¥aâ‹…lyâ‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â‹…ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦l_{x}\cdot l_{y}\geq a\cdot l_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_a â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Also aâ‹…lyâ‰¥lzâ‹…ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§a\cdot l_{y}\geq l_{z}italic_a â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

lzâ‰¤lxâ‹…ly.subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦l_{z}\leq l_{x}\cdot l_{y}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

So lxâ‹…lyâˆˆ[lz..hz]l_{x}\cdot l_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] and consequently by the definition of the integer intervals division

lxâˆˆDz/DyÂ andÂ lyâˆˆDz/Dx.lxâˆˆDz/DyÂ andÂ lyâˆˆDz/Dx\mbox{$l_{x}\in D_{z}/D_{y}$ and $l_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}$}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Case 3. lx<0<hx,lyâ‰¥0formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥0subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦0l_{x}<0<h_{x},\ l_{y}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0 < italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0.

The proof for this case is somewhat more elaborate. By the bounds consistency of xğ‘¥xitalic_x for some bâˆˆ[ly,hy]ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘¦b\in[l_{y},h_{y}]italic_b âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have lxâ‹…bâˆˆ[lz,hz]â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘§l_{x}\cdot b\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then lyâ‰¤bsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦ğ‘l_{y}\leq bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_b and lx<0subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥0l_{x}<0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0, so lxâ‹…lyâ‰¥lxâ‹…bâ‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥ğ‘l_{x}\cdot l_{y}\geq l_{x}\cdot bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b. But also lxâ‹…bâ‰¥lzâ‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§l_{x}\cdot b\geq l_{z}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b â‰¥ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

lzâ‰¤lxâ‹…ly.subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦l_{z}\leq l_{x}\cdot l_{y}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Next, by the bounds consistency of yğ‘¦yitalic_y for some aâˆˆ[lx,hx]ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¥a\in[l_{x},h_{x}]italic_a âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have aâ‹…lyâˆˆ[lz,hz]â‹…ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘§a\cdot l_{y}\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_a â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then lxâ‰¤asubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥ğ‘l_{x}\leq aitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_a and lyâ‰¥0subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦0l_{y}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0, so lxâ‹…lyâ‰¤aâ‹…lyâ‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â‹…ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦l_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq a\cdot l_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_a â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. But also aâ‹…lyâ‰¤hzâ‹…ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘§a\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{z}italic_a â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

lxâ‹…lyâ‰¤hz.â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘§l_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{z}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

So lxâ‹…lyâˆˆ[lz..hz]l_{x}\cdot l_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] and consequently by the definition of the integer intervals division

lxâˆˆDz/DyÂ andÂ lyâˆˆDz/Dx.lxâˆˆDz/DyÂ andÂ lyâˆˆDz/Dx\mbox{$l_{x}\in D_{z}/D_{y}$ and $l_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}$}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Further, by the bounds consistency of xğ‘¥xitalic_x for some bâˆˆ[ly,hy]ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘¦b\in[l_{y},h_{y}]italic_b âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have hxâ‹…bâˆˆ[lz,hz]â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘§h_{x}\cdot b\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then lyâ‰¤bsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦ğ‘l_{y}\leq bitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_b and hx>0subscriptâ„ğ‘¥0h_{x}>0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0, so hxâ‹…lyâ‰¤hxâ‹…bâ‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥ğ‘h_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{x}\cdot bitalic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b. But also hxâ‹…bâ‰¤hzâ‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥ğ‘subscriptâ„ğ‘§h_{x}\cdot b\leq h_{z}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

hxâ‹…lyâ‰¤hz.â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘§h_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{z}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Next, we already noted that by the bounds consistency of yğ‘¦yitalic_y for some aâˆˆ[lx,hx]ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¥a\in[l_{x},h_{x}]italic_a âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] we have aâ‹…lyâˆˆ[lz,hz]â‹…ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘§a\cdot l_{y}\in[l_{z},h_{z}]italic_a â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Then aâ‰¤hxğ‘subscriptâ„ğ‘¥a\leq h_{x}italic_a â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and lyâ‰¥0subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦0l_{y}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0, so aâ‹…lyâ‰¤hxâ‹…lyâ‹…ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦a\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{x}\cdot l_{y}italic_a â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. But also lzâ‰¤aâ‹…lysubscriptğ‘™ğ‘§â‹…ğ‘subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦l_{z}\leq a\cdot l_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_a â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so

lzâ‰¤hxâ‹…ly.subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦l_{z}\leq h_{x}\cdot l_{y}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

So hxâ‹…lyâˆˆ[lz..hz]h_{x}\cdot l_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] and consequently by the definition of the integer intervals division

hxâˆˆDz/Dy.subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¦\mbox{$h_{x}\in D_{z}/D_{y}$}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

It remains to prove that hyâˆˆDz/Dxsubscriptâ„ğ‘¦subscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¥h_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. We showed already lxâ‹…lyâ‰¤hzâ‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘§l_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{z}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Moreover, lx<0subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥0l_{x}<0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0 and lyâ‰¤hysubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘¦l_{y}\leq h_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so lxâ‹…hyâ‰¤lxâ‹…lyâ‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦l_{x}\cdot h_{y}\leq l_{x}\cdot l_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hence

lxâ‹…hyâ‰¤hz.â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘§l_{x}\cdot h_{y}\leq h_{z}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Also we showed already lzâ‰¤hxâ‹…lysubscriptğ‘™ğ‘§â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦l_{z}\leq h_{x}\cdot l_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Moreover hx>0subscriptâ„ğ‘¥0h_{x}>0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 and lyâ‰¤hysubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘¦l_{y}\leq h_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so hxâ‹…lyâ‰¤hxâ‹…hyâ‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦h_{x}\cdot l_{y}\leq h_{x}\cdot h_{y}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hence

lzâ‰¤hxâ‹…hy.subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦l_{z}\leq h_{x}\cdot h_{y}.italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

So if either lzâ‰¤lxâ‹…hysubscriptğ‘™ğ‘§â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦l_{z}\leq l_{x}\cdot h_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or hxâ‹…hyâ‰¤hzâ‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘§h_{x}\cdot h_{y}\leq h_{z}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then either lxâ‹…hyâˆˆ[lz..hz]l_{x}\cdot h_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] or hxâ‹…hyâˆˆ[lz..hz]h_{x}\cdot h_{y}\in[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] and consequently hyâˆˆDz/Dxsubscriptâ„ğ‘¦subscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¥h_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

If both lxâ‹…hy<lzâ‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§l_{x}\cdot h_{y}<l_{z}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and hz<hxâ‹…hysubscriptâ„ğ‘§â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¦h_{z}<h_{x}\cdot h_{y}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then

[lz..hz]âŠ†[lx..hx]â‹…hy.[l_{z}..h_{z}]\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}[l_{x}..h_{x}]\cdot h_{y}.[ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] âŠ† [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

In particular for some aâˆˆDxğ‘subscriptğ·ğ‘¥a\in D_{x}italic_a âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT we have lz=aâ‹…hysubscriptğ‘™ğ‘§â‹…ğ‘subscriptâ„ğ‘¦l_{z}=a\cdot h_{y}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_a â‹… italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so hyâˆˆDz/Dxsubscriptâ„ğ‘¦subscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¥h_{y}\in D_{z}/D_{x}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, as well.

This concludes the proof for this case. â–¡â–¡\Boxâ–¡

Proof of the Bounds consistency Theorem 9.3.

We consider each variable in turn. We begin with xğ‘¥xitalic_x. Suppose that Dx=[lx..hx]D_{x}=[l_{x}..h_{x}]italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Ï•italic-Ï•\phiitalic_Ï• is closed under the applications of the MULTIPLICATION 2 rule, so

{lx,hx}âŠ†â¢intâ¡(Dz/Dy).{lx,hx}âŠ†intsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¦\mbox{$\{{l_{x},h_{x}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y}).{lx,hx} âŠ† roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) . (8)

To show the bounds consistency of xğ‘¥xitalic_x amounts to showing

{lx,hx}âŠ†â¢DzÂ¯âŠ˜DyÂ¯.âŠ˜{lx,hx}âŠ†Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘§Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘¦\mbox{$\{{l_{x},h_{x}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}.{lx,hx} âŠ† overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âŠ˜ overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG . (9)

(Recall that given real intervals Xğ‘‹Xitalic_X and Yğ‘ŒYitalic_Y we denote by XâŠ˜YâŠ˜ğ‘‹ğ‘ŒX\oslash Yitalic_X âŠ˜ italic_Y their division, defined in Section 3.)

Case 1. intâ¡(Dz/Dy)=ğ’µintsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¦ğ’µ\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})={\cal Z}roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = caligraphic_Z.

This implies that 0âˆˆDzâˆ©Dy0subscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¦0\in D_{z}\cap D_{y}0 âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆ© italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, so by the definition of real intervals division DzÂ¯âŠ˜DyÂ¯=âŸ¨âˆ’âˆ,âˆâŸ©âŠ˜Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘§Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘¦\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}=\langle-\infty,\infty\rangleoverÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âŠ˜ overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG = âŸ¨ - âˆ , âˆ âŸ©. Hence (9) holds.

Case 2. intâ¡(Dz/Dy)â‰ ğ’µintsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¦ğ’µ\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})\neq{\cal Z}roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰  caligraphic_Z.

So intâ¡(Dz/Dy)intsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¦\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is an integer interval, say int(Dz/Dy)=[lzâ¢y..hzâ¢y]\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})=[l_{zy}..h_{zy}]roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. Two subcases arise.

Subcase 1. DzÂ¯âŠ˜DyÂ¯âŠ˜Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘§Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘¦\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âŠ˜ overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG is a, possibly open ended, real interval.

By (8) for some b1,b2âˆˆDysubscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2subscriptğ·ğ‘¦b_{1},b_{2}\in D_{y}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and c1,c2âˆˆDzsubscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2subscriptğ·ğ‘§c_{1},c_{2}\in D_{z}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT we have

lzâ¢yâ‹…b1=c1,â‹…subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§ğ‘¦subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘1l_{zy}\cdot b_{1}=c_{1},italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,
hzâ¢yâ‹…b2=c2.â‹…subscriptâ„ğ‘§ğ‘¦subscriptğ‘2subscriptğ‘2h_{zy}\cdot b_{2}=c_{2}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Let

bÂ¯:=minâ¡(b1,b2),bÂ¯:=maxâ¡(b1,b2),cÂ¯:=minâ¡(c1,c2),cÂ¯:=maxâ¡(c1,c2).formulae-sequenceassignÂ¯ğ‘minsubscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2formulae-sequenceassignÂ¯ğ‘maxsubscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2formulae-sequenceassignÂ¯ğ‘minsubscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2assignÂ¯ğ‘maxsubscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2\underline{b}:=\operatorname{min}(b_{1},b_{2}),\overline{b}:=\operatorname{max}(b_{1},b_{2}),\underline{c}:=\operatorname{min}(c_{1},c_{2}),\overline{c}:=\operatorname{max}(c_{1},c_{2}).underÂ¯ start_ARG italic_b end_ARG := roman_min ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_b end_ARG := roman_max ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , underÂ¯ start_ARG italic_c end_ARG := roman_min ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_c end_ARG := roman_max ( italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

So {lzâ¢y,hzâ¢y}âŠ†â¢[cÂ¯,cÂ¯]âŠ˜[bÂ¯,bÂ¯]âŠ˜{lzâ¢y,hzâ¢y}âŠ†Â¯ğ‘Â¯ğ‘Â¯ğ‘Â¯ğ‘\mbox{$\{{l_{zy},h_{zy}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}[\underline{c},\overline{c}]\oslash[\underline{b},\overline{b}]{lzy,hzy} âŠ† [ underÂ¯ start_ARG italic_c end_ARG , overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_c end_ARG ] âŠ˜ [ underÂ¯ start_ARG italic_b end_ARG , overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_b end_ARG ]. Also [cÂ¯,cÂ¯]âŠ˜[bÂ¯,bÂ¯]âŠ†DzÂ¯âŠ˜DyÂ¯âŠ˜Â¯ğ‘Â¯ğ‘Â¯ğ‘Â¯ğ‘âŠ˜Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘§Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘¦[\underline{c},\overline{c}]\oslash[\underline{b},\overline{b}]\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}[ underÂ¯ start_ARG italic_c end_ARG , overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_c end_ARG ] âŠ˜ [ underÂ¯ start_ARG italic_b end_ARG , overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_b end_ARG ] âŠ† overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âŠ˜ overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. Hence {lzâ¢y,hzâ¢y}âŠ†â¢DzÂ¯âŠ˜DyÂ¯âŠ˜{lzâ¢y,hzâ¢y}âŠ†Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘§Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘¦\mbox{$\{{l_{zy},h_{zy}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}{lzy,hzy} âŠ† overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âŠ˜ overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG and consequently, by the assumption for this subcase, [lzâ¢y,hzâ¢y]âŠ†DzÂ¯âŠ˜DyÂ¯subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘§ğ‘¦âŠ˜Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘§Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘¦[l_{zy},h_{zy}]\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}[ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] âŠ† overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âŠ˜ overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG. This proves (9) since by (8) {lx,hx}âŠ†â¢[lzâ¢y,hzâ¢y]{lx,hx}âŠ†subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘§ğ‘¦\mbox{$\{{l_{x},h_{x}}\}$}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}[l_{zy},h_{zy}]{lx,hx} âŠ† [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ].

Subcase 2. DzÂ¯âŠ˜DyÂ¯âŠ˜Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘§Â¯subscriptğ·ğ‘¦\overline{D_{z}}\oslash\overline{D_{y}}overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG âŠ˜ overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG is not a, possibly open ended, real interval.

In what follows for an integer interval D:=[l..h]D:=[l..h]italic_D := [ italic_l . . italic_h ] we write D>0ğ·0D>0italic_D > 0 if l>0ğ‘™0l>0italic_l > 0, D<0ğ·0D<0italic_D < 0 if h<0â„0h<0italic_h < 0. Also recall that âŸ¨DâŸ©:={xâˆˆğ’µâˆ£l<x<h}assigndelimited-âŸ¨âŸ©ğ·conditional-setğ‘¥ğ’µğ‘™ğ‘¥â„\langle D\rangle:=\mbox{$\{{x\in{\cal Z}\mid l<x<h}\}$}âŸ¨ italic_D âŸ© := { italic_x âˆˆ caligraphic_Z âˆ£ italic_l < italic_x < italic_h }.

This subcase can arise only when Dz>0subscriptğ·ğ‘§0D_{z}>0italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 and 0âˆˆâŸ¨DyâŸ©0delimited-âŸ¨âŸ©subscriptğ·ğ‘¦0\in\langle D_{y}\rangle0 âˆˆ âŸ¨ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŸ© or Dz<0subscriptğ·ğ‘§0D_{z}<0italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0 and 0âˆˆâŸ¨DyâŸ©0delimited-âŸ¨âŸ©subscriptğ·ğ‘¦0\in\langle D_{y}\rangle0 âˆˆ âŸ¨ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŸ©, see [18] (reported as Theorem 4.8 in [15]), where the definition of the division of real intervals is considered.

Since Ï•italic-Ï•\phiitalic_Ï• is closed under the MULTIPLICATION rule 3

DyâŠ†intâ¡(Dz/Dx).subscriptğ·ğ‘¦intsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¥D_{y}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x}).italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŠ† roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

So intâ¡(Dz/Dx)â‰ âˆ…intsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¥\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})\neq\mbox{$\emptyset$}roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰  âˆ… since by assumption Dysubscriptğ·ğ‘¦D_{y}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is non-empty. Also, since 0âˆ‰Dz0subscriptğ·ğ‘§0\not\in D_{z}0 âˆ‰ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we have intâ¡(Dz/Dx)â‰ ğ’µintsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¥ğ’µ\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})\neq{\cal Z}roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) â‰  caligraphic_Z. So intâ¡(Dz/Dx)intsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¥\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is a non-empty integer interval such that 0âˆˆâŸ¨intâ¡(Dz/Dx)âŸ©0delimited-âŸ¨âŸ©intsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¥0\in\langle\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})\rangle0 âˆˆ âŸ¨ roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âŸ©.

But Dz>0subscriptğ·ğ‘§0D_{z}>0italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 or Dz<0subscriptğ·ğ‘§0D_{z}<0italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0, so if Dx>0subscriptğ·ğ‘¥0D_{x}>0italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0, then intâ¡(Dz/Dx)>0intsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¥0\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})>0roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) > 0 or intâ¡(Dz/Dx)<0intsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¥0\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})<0roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) < 0 and if Dx<0subscriptğ·ğ‘¥0D_{x}<0italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0, then intâ¡(Dz/Dx)>0intsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¥0\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})>0roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) > 0 or intâ¡(Dz/Dx)<0intsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¥0\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{x})<0roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) < 0, as well. So 0âˆˆâŸ¨DxâŸ©0delimited-âŸ¨âŸ©subscriptğ·ğ‘¥0\in\langle D_{x}\rangle0 âˆˆ âŸ¨ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŸ©. Hence 0âˆˆâŸ¨DxâŸ©âˆ©âŸ¨DyâŸ©0delimited-âŸ¨âŸ©subscriptğ·ğ‘¥delimited-âŸ¨âŸ©subscriptğ·ğ‘¦0\in\langle D_{x}\rangle\cap\langle D_{y}\rangle0 âˆˆ âŸ¨ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŸ© âˆ© âŸ¨ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŸ© while 0âˆ‰Dz0subscriptğ·ğ‘§0\not\in D_{z}0 âˆ‰ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. This contradicts (5). So this subcase cannot arise.

The proof for the variable yğ‘¦yitalic_y is symmetric to the one for the variable xğ‘¥xitalic_x.

Consider now the variable zğ‘§zitalic_z. Ï•italic-Ï•\phiitalic_Ï• is closed under the applications of the MULTIPLICATION 1 rule, so

DzâŠ†intâ¡(Dxâ‹…Dy).subscriptğ·ğ‘§intâ‹…subscriptğ·ğ‘¥subscriptğ·ğ‘¦D_{z}\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\operatorname{int}(D_{x}\cdot D_{y}).italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŠ† roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

Take now câˆˆDzğ‘subscriptğ·ğ‘§c\in D_{z}italic_c âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then there exist a1,a2âˆˆDxsubscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2subscriptğ·ğ‘¥a_{1},a_{2}\in D_{x}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and b1,b2âˆˆDysubscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2subscriptğ·ğ‘¦b_{1},b_{2}\in D_{y}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that a1â‹…b1â‰¤câ‰¤a2â‹…b2.â‹…subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘1ğ‘â‹…subscriptğ‘2subscriptğ‘2a_{1}\cdot b_{1}\leq c\leq a_{2}\cdot b_{2}.italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_c â‰¤ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . We can assume that both inequalities are strict, that is,

a1â‹…b1<c<a2â‹…b2,â‹…subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘1ğ‘â‹…subscriptğ‘2subscriptğ‘2a_{1}\cdot b_{1}<c<a_{2}\cdot b_{2},italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , (10)

since otherwise the desired conclusion is established.

Let

aÂ¯:=minâ¡(a1,a2),aÂ¯:=maxâ¡(a1,a2),bÂ¯:=minâ¡(b1,b2),bÂ¯:=maxâ¡(b1,b2).formulae-sequenceassignÂ¯ğ‘minsubscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2formulae-sequenceassignÂ¯ğ‘maxsubscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2formulae-sequenceassignÂ¯ğ‘minsubscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2assignÂ¯ğ‘maxsubscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2\underline{a}:=\operatorname{min}(a_{1},a_{2}),\overline{a}:=\operatorname{max}(a_{1},a_{2}),\underline{b}:=\operatorname{min}(b_{1},b_{2}),\overline{b}:=\operatorname{max}(b_{1},b_{2}).underÂ¯ start_ARG italic_a end_ARG := roman_min ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_a end_ARG := roman_max ( italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , underÂ¯ start_ARG italic_b end_ARG := roman_min ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_b end_ARG := roman_max ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

We now show that aâˆˆ[aÂ¯..aÂ¯]a\in[\underline{a}..\overline{a}]italic_a âˆˆ [ underÂ¯ start_ARG italic_a end_ARG . . overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_a end_ARG ] and bâˆˆ[bÂ¯..bÂ¯]b\in[\underline{b}..\overline{b}]italic_b âˆˆ [ underÂ¯ start_ARG italic_b end_ARG . . overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_b end_ARG ] exist such that c=aâ‹…bğ‘â‹…ğ‘ğ‘c=a\cdot bitalic_c = italic_a â‹… italic_b. Since [aÂ¯..aÂ¯]âŠ†DxÂ¯[\underline{a}..\overline{a}]\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\overline{D_{x}}[ underÂ¯ start_ARG italic_a end_ARG . . overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_a end_ARG ] âŠ† overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG and [bÂ¯..bÂ¯]âŠ†DyÂ¯[\underline{b}..\overline{b}]\mbox{$\>\subseteq\>$}\overline{D_{y}}[ underÂ¯ start_ARG italic_b end_ARG . . overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_b end_ARG ] âŠ† overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG, this will establish the bounds consistency of zğ‘§zitalic_z.

The choice of ağ‘aitalic_a and bğ‘bitalic_b depends on the signs of a1subscriptğ‘1a_{1}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and b2subscriptğ‘2b_{2}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. When one of these values is zero, the choice is provided in the following table, where in each case on the account of (10) no division by zero takes place:

condition ağ‘aitalic_a bğ‘bitalic_b
a1=0subscriptğ‘10a_{1}=0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 c/b2ğ‘subscriptğ‘2c/b_{2}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT b2subscriptğ‘2b_{2}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
a2=0subscriptğ‘20a_{2}=0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 c/b1ğ‘subscriptğ‘1c/b_{1}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT b1subscriptğ‘1b_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
b1=0subscriptğ‘10b_{1}=0italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 a2subscriptğ‘2a_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT c/a2ğ‘subscriptğ‘2c/a_{2}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
b2=0subscriptğ‘20b_{2}=0italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 a1subscriptğ‘1a_{1}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT c/a1ğ‘subscriptğ‘1c/a_{1}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

It is straightforward to show that in each case the quotient belongs to the corresponding interval. For example, when a1=0subscriptğ‘10a_{1}=0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 0 we need to prove that c/b2âˆˆ[aÂ¯..aÂ¯]c/b_{2}\in[\underline{a}..\overline{a}]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ underÂ¯ start_ARG italic_a end_ARG . . overÂ¯ start_ARG italic_a end_ARG ]. By (10) a2â‰ 0subscriptğ‘20a_{2}\neq 0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰  0. If a2>0subscriptğ‘20a_{2}>0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0, then again by (10), b2>0subscriptğ‘20b_{2}>0italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0, so c/b2âˆˆ[0..a2]c/b_{2}\in[0..a_{2}]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ 0 . . italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. In turn, if a2<0subscriptğ‘20a_{2}<0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0, then also by (10) b2<0subscriptğ‘20b_{2}<0italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0, so, yet again by (10), c/b2âˆˆ[a2â¢..0]ğ‘subscriptğ‘2delimited-[]subscriptğ‘2..0c/b_{2}\in[a_{2}..0]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ..0 ].

When neither a1subscriptğ‘1a_{1}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT nor b2subscriptğ‘2b_{2}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is zero, the choice of ağ‘aitalic_a and bğ‘bitalic_b has to be argued case by case.

Case 1. a1>0,b2>0formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘10subscriptğ‘20a_{1}>0,\ b_{2}>0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0.

Then by (10) b1<c/a1subscriptğ‘1ğ‘subscriptğ‘1b_{1}<c/a_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and c/b2<a2ğ‘subscriptğ‘2subscriptğ‘2c/b_{2}<a_{2}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Suppose that both b2<c/a1subscriptğ‘2ğ‘subscriptğ‘1b_{2}<c/a_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and c/b2<a1ğ‘subscriptğ‘2subscriptğ‘1c/b_{2}<a_{1}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then a1â‹…b2<c<a1â‹…b2â‹…subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2ğ‘â‹…subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2a_{1}\cdot b_{2}<c<a_{1}\cdot b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which is a contradiction. So either c/a1â‰¤b2ğ‘subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2c/a_{1}\leq b_{2}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or a1â‰¤c/b2subscriptğ‘1ğ‘subscriptğ‘2a_{1}\leq c/b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, that is either c/a1âˆˆ[b1..b2]c/a_{1}\in[b_{1}..b_{2}]italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] or c/b2âˆˆ[a1..a2]c/b_{2}\in[a_{1}..a_{2}]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ].

Case 2. a1>0,b2<0formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘10subscriptğ‘20a_{1}>0,\ b_{2}<0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0.

Then by (10) b1<c/a1subscriptğ‘1ğ‘subscriptğ‘1b_{1}<c/a_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and a2<c/b2subscriptğ‘2ğ‘subscriptğ‘2a_{2}<c/b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Suppose that both b2<c/a1subscriptğ‘2ğ‘subscriptğ‘1b_{2}<c/a_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and a1<c/b2subscriptğ‘1ğ‘subscriptğ‘2a_{1}<c/b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then a1â‹…b2<c<a1â‹…b2â‹…subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2ğ‘â‹…subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2a_{1}\cdot b_{2}<c<a_{1}\cdot b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which is a contradiction. So either c/a1â‰¤b2ğ‘subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2c/a_{1}\leq b_{2}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or c/b2â‰¤a2ğ‘subscriptğ‘2subscriptğ‘2c/b_{2}\leq a_{2}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, that is either c/a1âˆˆ[b1..b2]c/a_{1}\in[b_{1}..b_{2}]italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] or c/b2âˆˆ[a2..a1]c/b_{2}\in[a_{2}..a_{1}]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ].

Case 3. a1<0,b2>0formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘10subscriptğ‘20a_{1}<0,\ b_{2}>0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0 , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0.

Then by (10) c/a1<b1ğ‘subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘1c/a_{1}<b_{1}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and c/b2<a2ğ‘subscriptğ‘2subscriptğ‘2c/b_{2}<a_{2}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Suppose that both c/a1<b2ğ‘subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2c/a_{1}<b_{2}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and c/b2<a1ğ‘subscriptğ‘2subscriptğ‘1c/b_{2}<a_{1}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then a1â‹…b2<c<a1â‹…b2â‹…subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2ğ‘â‹…subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2a_{1}\cdot b_{2}<c<a_{1}\cdot b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which is a contradiction. So either b2â‰¤c/a1subscriptğ‘2ğ‘subscriptğ‘1b_{2}\leq c/a_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or a1â‰¤c/b2subscriptğ‘1ğ‘subscriptğ‘2a_{1}\leq c/b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, that is either c/a1âˆˆ[b2..b1]c/a_{1}\in[b_{2}..b_{1}]italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] or c/b2âˆˆ[a1..a2]c/b_{2}\in[a_{1}..a_{2}]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ].

Case 4. a1<0,b2<0formulae-sequencesubscriptğ‘10subscriptğ‘20a_{1}<0,\ b_{2}<0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0 , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0.

Then by (10) c/a1<b1ğ‘subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘1c/a_{1}<b_{1}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and a2<c/b2subscriptğ‘2ğ‘subscriptğ‘2a_{2}<c/b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Suppose that both c/a1<b2ğ‘subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2c/a_{1}<b_{2}italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and a1<c/b2subscriptğ‘1ğ‘subscriptğ‘2a_{1}<c/b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then a1â‹…b2<c<a1â‹…b2â‹…subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2ğ‘â‹…subscriptğ‘1subscriptğ‘2a_{1}\cdot b_{2}<c<a_{1}\cdot b_{2}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < italic_c < italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‹… italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, which is a contradiction. So either b2â‰¤c/a1subscriptğ‘2ğ‘subscriptğ‘1b_{2}\leq c/a_{1}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or c/b2â‰¤a1ğ‘subscriptğ‘2subscriptğ‘1c/b_{2}\leq a_{1}italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, that is either c/a1âˆˆ[b2..b1]c/a_{1}\in[b_{2}..b_{1}]italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] or c/b2âˆˆ[a2..a1]c/b_{2}\in[a_{2}..a_{1}]italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âˆˆ [ italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ].

So in each of the four cases we can choose either a:=a1assignğ‘subscriptğ‘1a:=a_{1}italic_a := italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and b:=c/a1assignğ‘ğ‘subscriptğ‘1b:=c/a_{1}italic_b := italic_c / italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or a:=c/b2assignğ‘ğ‘subscriptğ‘2a:=c/b_{2}italic_a := italic_c / italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and b:=b2assignğ‘subscriptğ‘2b:=b_{2}italic_b := italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. â–¡â–¡\Boxâ–¡

Proof of the MULTIPLICATION Theorem 10.1.

The weak interval division produces larger sets than the interval division. As a result the MULTIPLICATION rules 2w and 3w yield a weaker reduction than the original MULTIPLICATION rules 2 and 3. So it suffices to prove that Ï•:=âŸ¨xâ‹…y=z;xâˆˆDx,yâˆˆDy,zâˆˆDzâŸ©assignitalic-Ï•delimited-âŸ¨âŸ©formulae-sequenceâ‹…ğ‘¥ğ‘¦ğ‘§formulae-sequenceğ‘¥subscriptğ·ğ‘¥formulae-sequenceğ‘¦subscriptğ·ğ‘¦ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘§\phi:=\langle x\cdot y=z\ ;\ x\in D_{x},y\in D_{y},z\in D_{z}\rangleitalic_Ï• := âŸ¨ italic_x â‹… italic_y = italic_z ; italic_x âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_y âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z âˆˆ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT âŸ© is closed under the applications of the MULTIPLICATION 1, 2 and 3 rules assuming that it is closed under the applications of the MULTIPLICATION 1, 2w and 3w rules. Suppose that Dx=[lx..hx],Dy=[ly..hy],Dz=[lz..hz]D_{x}=[l_{x}..h_{x}],D_{y}=[l_{y}..h_{y}],D_{z}=[l_{z}..h_{z}]italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] , italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] , italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = [ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . . italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ]. The assumption implies

{lx,hx}âŠ†intâ¡(Dz:Dy)subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¥int:subscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¦\{l_{x},h_{x}\}\subseteq\operatorname{int}(D_{z}:D_{y}){ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } âŠ† roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (11)

and

{ly,hy}âŠ†intâ¡(Dz:Dx)subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘¦int:subscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¥\{l_{y},h_{y}\}\subseteq\operatorname{int}(D_{z}:D_{x}){ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } âŠ† roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) (12)

The proof is by contradiction. Assume that (11) and (12) hold, while Ï•italic-Ï•\phiitalic_Ï• is not closed under application of MULTIPLICATION 2 and 3. Without loss of generality, suppose that MULTIPLICATION 2 is the rule that can make a further reduction. This is the case iff

intâ¡(Dz/Dy)âŠ‚intâ¡(Dz:Dy).intsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¦int:subscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¦\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})\subset\operatorname{int}(D_{z}:D_{y}).roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) âŠ‚ roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

By definition, the proper inclusion implies that lyâ‰¥0subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦0l_{y}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0 or hyâ‰¤0subscriptâ„ğ‘¦0h_{y}\leq 0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ 0. Assume lyâ‰¥0subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦0l_{y}\geq 0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¥ 0, the case for hyâ‰¤0subscriptâ„ğ‘¦0h_{y}\leq 0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT â‰¤ 0 is similar. Let lyâ€²:=maxâ¡(1,ly)assignsuperscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²max1subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦l_{y}^{\prime}:=\operatorname{max}(1,l_{y})italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT := roman_max ( 1 , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), and let A:={lz/lyâ€²,lz/hy,hz/lyâ€²,hz/hy}assignğ´subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘¦subscriptâ„ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²subscriptâ„ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘¦A:=\{l_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime},l_{z}/h_{y},h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime},h_{z}/h_{y}\}italic_A := { italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }, and B:={lz/lx,lz/hx,hz/lx,hz/hx}assignğµsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘§subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘¥B:=\{l_{z}/l_{x},l_{z}/h_{x},h_{z}/l_{x},h_{z}/h_{x}\}italic_B := { italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT }. A further implication of the proper inclusion is that one or both of lyâ€²superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and hysubscriptâ„ğ‘¦h_{y}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT do not have a multiple in Dzsubscriptğ·ğ‘§D_{z}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT: otherwise minâ¡(A)minğ´\operatorname{min}(A)roman_min ( italic_A ) and maxâ¡(A)maxğ´\operatorname{max}(A)roman_max ( italic_A ) would be elements of Dz/Dysubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¦D_{z}/D_{y}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and we would have intâ¡(Dz:Dy)=intâ¡(Dz/Dy)int:subscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¦intsubscriptğ·ğ‘§subscriptğ·ğ‘¦\operatorname{int}(D_{z}:D_{y})=\operatorname{int}(D_{z}/D_{y})roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = roman_int ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). In what follows we can assume 0âˆ‰Dz0subscriptğ·ğ‘§0\notin D_{z}0 âˆ‰ italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, since otherwise lyâ€²superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and hysubscriptâ„ğ‘¦h_{y}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT do have a multiple in Dzsubscriptğ·ğ‘§D_{z}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.


Case 1. lz>0subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§0l_{z}>0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0.

A further consequence of (11) is that lx,hx>0subscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥subscriptâ„ğ‘¥0l_{x},h_{x}>0italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0. Because lyâ€²superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is no divisor of lzsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘§l_{z}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and both numbers are positive, we have âŒŠlz/lyâ€²âŒ‹<lz/lyâ€²subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²\lfloor l_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rfloor<l_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}âŒŠ italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŒ‹ < italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, and consequently lyâ€²>lz/(lz/lyâ€²)superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§subscriptğ‘™ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²l_{y}^{\prime}>l_{z}/(l_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime})italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / ( italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), leading to lyâ€²>lyâ€²superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²l_{y}^{\prime}>l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which is a contradiction.


Case 2. hz<0subscriptâ„ğ‘§0h_{z}<0italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT < 0.

We use this information in the following implication of (12):

lyâ€²â‰¥âŒˆminâ¡(B)âŒ‰=âŒˆhz/lxâ€²âŒ‰â‰¥hz/lxâ€²superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²minğµsubscriptâ„ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥â€²subscriptâ„ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¥â€²l_{y}^{\prime}\geq\lceil\operatorname{min}(B)\rceil=\lceil h_{z}/l_{x}^{\prime}\rceil\geq h_{z}/l_{x}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¥ âŒˆ roman_min ( italic_B ) âŒ‰ = âŒˆ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŒ‰ â‰¥ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

to get lyâ€²â‰¥hz/âŒˆhz/lyâ€²âŒ‰superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²subscriptâ„ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²l_{y}^{\prime}\geq h_{z}/\lceil h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rceilitalic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â‰¥ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / âŒˆ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŒ‰. Because |âŒˆhz/lyâ€²âŒ‰|<|hz/lyâ€²|subscriptâ„ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²subscriptâ„ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²|\lceil h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}\rceil|<|h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime}|| âŒˆ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT âŒ‰ | < | italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT |, we have lyâ€²>hz/(hz/lyâ€²)superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²subscriptâ„ğ‘§subscriptâ„ğ‘§superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²l_{y}^{\prime}>h_{z}/(h_{z}/l_{y}^{\prime})italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), leading to lyâ€²>lyâ€²superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²superscriptsubscriptğ‘™ğ‘¦â€²l_{y}^{\prime}>l_{y}^{\prime}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT > italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT â€² end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, which is a contradiction. â–¡â–¡\Boxâ–¡
